column2: MONTANA DMV WRITTEN TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. This road sign means:
column6: Keep right, traffic is entering from another road.
column8: Winding Road Ahead

column2: 2. What should drivers do when the red lights begin to flash?
column8: Slow down.

column2: 3. Regulation signs normally are ____ rectangles with ____ letters or symbols.
column8: white; black

column2: 4. This road sign means:
column4: Vehicles may only travel in the center lane.
column6: The center lane in both directions of travel will soon turn left.
column8: Sharp left turns ahead, in both directions.
column10: The center lane is shared for left turns in both directions of travel.

column2: 5. You face a green light, but traffic on the other side of the intersection does not allow you to travel all the way through the intersection. What must you do?
column4: Enter the intersection and wait until traffic ahead clears.
column6: Wait for the next green light.
column8: Wait until traffic ahead clears, so you do not block the intersection.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column4: Right turn permitted on red light
column8: No U-turns

column2: 7. Before a school bus stops to load passengers, the driver will usually flash:
column8: red warning lights.

column2: 8. This traffic sign warns you about:
column8: a hill or a downgrade up ahead on the road.

column2: 9. The picture shows:
column8: a railroad advance warning sign.

column2: 10. A flashing red traffic light:
column4: has the same meaning as a stop sign.
column6: indicates that you should drive with caution.
column8: is used to indicate a pedestrian crossing.
column10: has the same meaning as a yield sign.

column2: 11. Drivers must be prepared for anything coming up in the road ahead. They should:
column4: scan the road for traffic conditions and possible hazards.
column6: drive with the right foot resting lightly on the brake pedal.
column8: stare straight ahead at all times.
column10: maintain focus toward the left of the road.

column2: 12. If your vehicle’s right wheels leave the pavement, you should:
column4: build up brake pressure by pumping the brake pedal several times.
column6: immediately come to a complete stop.
column8: maintain your current speed to gain better traction.
column10: take your foot off the gas and when you are slowed down, ease back on the road when it is safe to do so.

column2: 13. What happens if two vehicles reach at the same time an intersection with four-way stop signs?
column4: The driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.
column8: The driver on the right yields to the driver on the left.
column10: The first vehicle to reach the intersection must yield.

column2: 14. When driving on a wet road:
column4: you must be aware that the pavement gets even more slippery when it's been raining for long periods of time.
column6: as you decrease your speed, the road becomes more slippery.
column8: as you drive faster, your tires may lose traction.
column10: you should follow the vehicle ahead of you more closely.

column2: 15. Traffic signs and pavement markings must be:
column4: followed only when other vehicles are present.
column8: always obeyed.
column10: followed only when a police officer is present.

column2: 16. This road sign means:
column8: No left turn

column2: 17. When you approach a railroad crossing without flashing warning signals or crossing gates, you should:
column6: yield to all trains at the crossing.
column8: cross the tracks as slowly as possible.
column10: speed up to beat the train.

column2: 18. Roads are most slippery:
column8: just before it rains.
column10: when it first starts to rain.

column2: 19. A broken white line:
column4: marks the right edge of the roadway.
column6: means passing or crossing is prohibited in that lane.
column8: separates two lanes traveling in the same direction.

column2: 20. What is a likely effect when you take another drug while you drink alcohol?
column4: If the drug is over-the-counter, there are no effects.
column6: There are no effects, unless the drug is prescription only.
column8: The effects of alcohol are reduced by the drug.
column10: The effects of the alcohol and the drug are enhanced.

column2: 21. What is the only effective method to reduce your BAC?
column6: Not drinking over a period of time.
column8: Drinking coffee.
column10: Eating before or while you drink.

column2: 22. In heavy rain, tires can begin to ride on the water that is on top of the road pavement. This is called:
column8: rideplaning.

column2: 23. This road sign means:
column6: Traffic flows only in the direction of the arrow
column8: No right turn

column2: 24. This road sign means:
column8: Yield the right-of-way

column2: 25. What does a yellow arrow signal mean?
column4: The same as a green light.
column6: The same as the yellow light, but applies only to movement in the direction of the arrow.
column8: Vehicles moving in all directions must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.

column2: 26. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Vehicles turning left must yield to bikes entering a right turn lane.
column6: Drivers have the right of way over bikes turning left.
column8: Motor vehicles entering an exclusive right-turn lane must weave across bicycle traffic in bicycle lanes.

column2: 27. This road sign means:
column4: Bicycles have the same rights as other vehicles
column6: Bicycles cross or ride beside traffic
column8: Yield to motorcyles, but not to bicycles

column2: 28. What should you do in case of a brake failure?
column4: Pull off the road into an open space, if available.
column8: Rub your tires on the curb to slow your car.

column2: 29. If traffic on the other side of an intersection is backed up and you cannot get completely through, you must:
column4: enter the intersection and proceed with caution.
column6: enter the intersection and try to avoid blocking it.
column8: turn right instead of going straight through the intersection.
column10: wait until traffic ahead is clear.

column2: 30. This road sign:
column4: warns drivers that U-turns are not permitted.
column6: provides an advance notice of a roundabout.
column8: warns drivers of a sharp turn left. Drivers should slow their speed and keep to the left.

column2: 31. Who has a greater risk of being involved in a traffic crash?
column8: Young people.

column2: 32. When driving on major highways you should:
column8: be ready to react to road hazards.

column2: 33. You reach an intersection that is not controlled at the same time as a driver on your right, and both of you prepare to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
column8: Both.

column2: 31. Who has a greater risk of being involved in a traffic crash?
column8: Young people.

column2: 32. When driving on major highways you should:
column8: be ready to react to road hazards.

column2: 33. You reach an intersection that is not controlled at the same time as a driver on your right, and both of you prepare to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
column8: Both.
